question.title: How do I query Jooq with "in", whilst also ensuring that the query is case-insensitive?
question.body:
I'm using Jooq with Java, and I'm trying to query a column, which needs to be case-insensitive, and needs to return all results within a given List<String>.

Having looked around for an answer, the closest I've gotten is MY_TABLE.MY_FIELD.equalIgnoreCase("abc") (Found in the answer to this question)

I could use this approach, but (I believe) that would require multiple queries. However, it's very likely that there is a much more efficient way of doing things.

Is there a Jooq method that can accomplish what I'm trying to do, or a "workaround" that achieves the same result, without causing more load than necessary on the db.

Integer warehouseId = 123;
ArrayList<String> productNames = new ArrayList<String>();

productNames.add("Lamp");
productNames.add("Laptop");

return getDslContext(instanceId)
                .select(TABLE_A.fields()) // Select all fields from TABLE_A
                .from(TABLE_A)
                .leftJoin(TABLE_B) // Join TABLE_B
                .on(TABLE_A.WAREHOUSE_ID.eq(TABLE_B.WAREHOUSE_ID)
                        .and(TABLE_A.SERIAL_NUMBER.eq(TABLE_B.SERIAL_NUMBER))
                        .and(TABLE_B.DELETE_DATE.isNull())) // Join condition on foreign key

                .where(TABLE_A.PRODUCT_NAME.inIgnoreCase(productNames) // <-- **the issue**
                .or(TABLE_B.PRODUCT_NAME.inIgnoreCase(productNames))) 

                .and(TABLE_A.WAREHOUSE_ID.eq(warehouseId))
                .and(TABLE_A.DELETE_DATE.isNull()) // Ensure Product is not deleted
                .fetchInto(TableARecord.class); // Convert result into TABLE_A_RECORD
